description:
This course covers descriptive statistics. In the course, you will learn:

Scales of measurement - nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio

Central Tendency - mean, median, and mode, including measures of central tendency and skewed distributions, as well as how to calculate the weighted mean

Variability - How to calculate the standard deviation and variance as well as how to interpret percentiles

Charts and Graphs - How to calculate a cumulative frequency distribution table as well as how to calculate a stem and leaf plot

Probability, the Normal Curve and z-Scores - An introduction to probability is provided, along with properties of the normal distribution and how to calculate and interpret z-scores

Also, nine quizzes are provided along with video coverage of the solutions to ensure understanding of the concepts.
title: Introduction to Statistics
